title: Textile, "East Rivers", 2009
medium:
Medium: acrylic on slubbed silk
Technique: dragbox, plaided
creditline: Gift of Tillett and Rauscher, Inc.
description: Very subtle striped effect combined by overlaying transparent shades of pink, yellow green, pale blue and gray.
justification: TAR’s textile East Rivers (ca. 2009) employs the drag box technique invented by D.D. and Leslie Tillett, using a muted palette of transparent tones of pink, yellow, gray and blue on slubbed silk. The design was created for a Brooklyn interior with panoramic views of the East River in an attempt to preserve the feeling of the sunset on the water when the curtains were closed.
